title: Creations
description: Here are a few of the things I've designed over the years

lego.title: Hindu Temple - Kandariya Mahadev
lego.subtitle: Khajuraho, India
lego.description: Kandariya Mahadeva, meaning 'Great God of the Cave', is a Hindu temple at Khajuraho in Madhya Pradesh, India. Famous for its ornate statutary, it is considered one of the best intact examples of royal temples from the medieval period. The temple was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1986. 4237 total pieces.

lego.title: Turkish Mosque - Aya Sofya
lego.subtitle: Istanbul, Turkiye
lego.description: Aya Sofya, originally known by the Greek name 'Hagia Sophia' or 'Holy Wisdom', was built as a cathedral under the Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian I in the 6th Century A.D. At the time of its completion, it was the world's largest interior space topped by the world's largest dome. After Istanbul's conquest by the Turkish Sultan Mehmed II in 1453, it was converted into a mosque. It was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1985. 2260 total pieces.

lego.title: Orthodox Church - Kizhi Pogost
lego.subtitle: Lake Ladoga, Russia
lego.description: Kizhi Pogost is a historical wooden church located on Lake Onega in northern Russia dating from the 17th century. With twenty-two domes, the Transfiguration Church is the largest wooden structure in the world build without structural nails. It was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1990. 3166 total pieces.

webapp.title: OldWorldSaints.com
webapp.subtitle: Spring Boot Java WebApp
webapp.description: This site displays information about important figures and commemorations in various traditions through the ancient and medieval world. It includes scrollable and clickable maps built using Leaflet JS, links to scanned primary source materials in PDF format, and multiple search interfaces keying on a range of possible criteria.
